reg:regulation.reg:title: Hospital Transfer Regulation
reg:regulation.reg:amsincluded: [includes amendments up to B.C. Reg. 211/2015, November 28, 2016]

bcl:section.bcl:text: The assets and liabilities of a society that has been designated as a hospital under the Hospital Act may be transferred to a board or council by

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the society agreeing to the transfer by special resolution as defined in section 1 of the Societies Act, and

the board or council agreeing to assume the assets and liabilities by bylaw passed by a majority of not less than 75% of the votes of the members of the board or council voting in person or by proxy after receiving at least 14 days' notice of the proposed bylaw.

reg:content.reg:provisionsnote: [Provisions relevant to the enactment of this regulation: Health Authorities Act, R.S.B.C. 1996, c. 180, section 21 (2)]
